description: Tejaswini-the Radiant is a scheme by the Jammu and Kashmir government aimed at empowering women by promoting entrepreneurship and self-employment. It provides financial assistance, training, and market linkages to women entrepreneurs and Self-Help Groups (SHGs) to establish sustainable micro-enterprises.
key_features: Financial support for women to start micro-enterprises
Training and skill development for entrepreneurship
Market linkages and support for SHGs

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to Rs. 5 Lakhs per beneficiary for setting up micro-enterprises
benefits.subsidy: Up to 50% subsidy on project cost, subject to a maximum limit
benefits.training: Free skill development and entrepreneurship training

residency_criteria: Must be a resident of Jammu and Kashmir
group_criteria: Individual women entrepreneurs or members of registered Self-Help Groups (SHGs)
business_criteria: Proposed micro-enterprise must be viable and sustainable

eligible_activities: Setting up micro-enterprises in sectors like handicrafts, agriculture, food processing, and services
Skill development and capacity building for entrepreneurship
Market promotion and networking for SHG products

steps: Obtain the application form from the District Development Commissionerâ€™s office or Jammu and Kashmir Entrepreneurship Development Institute (JKEDI)
Submit a detailed project proposal with business plan
Attach required documents, including proof of identity, residency, and SHG registration (if applicable)
Applications are reviewed by a district-level committee
Approved applicants receive funding and training support
application_process.note: Applicants must attend a mandatory entrepreneurship training program

special_notes: Priority is given to women from economically weaker sections
The scheme encourages group-based enterprises through SHGs
Beneficiaries must undergo mandatory training before fund disbursement
